details:
It was discovered that missing input validation in minidlna, a lightweight
DLNA/UPnP-AV server could result in the execution of arbitrary code. In
addition minidlna was susceptible to the CallStranger UPnP
vulnerability.


For Debian 9 stretch, these problems have been fixed in version
1.1.6+dfsg-1+deb9u1.


We recommend that you upgrade your minidlna packages.


For the detailed security status of minidlna please refer to
its security tracker page at:
<https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/minidlna>


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
